comments:
following the log i get _every_ time i try firefox. no help available, only a bunch of underdone 
workarounds -- MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME is obviously _not_ read, but a file called /etc/gre.conf.

This bug is about the second exception (the NS_InitEmbedding one) right?

What version of Firefox is that and how did you install it?

The eclipse executable uses the MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME environment variable
to locate mozilla if it is set.  Otherwise, it checks /etc/gre.conf and if that
is not found it checks /etc/gre.d/gre.conf.

  http://www.mozilla.org/projects/embedding/GRE.html

If it's looking for firefox in /opt/firefox/ then it was downloaded from 
somewhere (mozilla.org?), and is probably not compiled to be embeddable.

i tried firefox both from debian/unstable and from mozilla.org.
probabyl it's not compiled embeddable -- but how does one tell?
i had to look for a rather crude howto to get an url where to download an older mozilla 1.7 said 
to work. the version officially downloadable uses gtk1, not gtk2 (and has probably other 
drawbacks, too).
i think at least the error-message ("org.eclipse.swt.SWTError: No more handles 
[NS_InitEmbedding /opt/firefox/ error - 2147221164]") should be far more informative, 
something like "embedding support missing" or so would have saved hours of trying and 
megabytes of download volume.
MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME seems only to be read, if set _before_ starting eclipse, setting in the 
launch configuration was not successful (but i have to doublecheck that).

is there an official location for swt/gtk to download firefox/mozilla from?

The mozilla-firefox package from debian unstable, last I checked, supported
embedding, as does the one from Ubuntu:

  http://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=13750

Eclipse should work with any Mozilla (not Firefox) from mozilla.org.  Eclipse
is also known to work with the mozilla shipped with the distributions listed
as the targets for 3.1 (RHEL3/4 and SuSE).  Finally, this bug tracks the request
for embedding support from firefox upstream:

  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=262453

I agree that the real bug here is that the error message should say "embedding
unsupported by this version of mozilla" or similar, if that is really the only
failure here.

MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME must be set, along with LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  This, as well
as the reading of th gre.conf file, is done by the eclipse executable.  When you
self-host, PDE simply launches "java" and does not use the executable.  This is
why you can't just set it in your launch config.  I bet it will work if you set
the LD_LIBRARY_PATH.  Sorry for the confusion.

One detail regarding "Eclipse should work with any Mozilla from mozilla.org" is 
that it must be a GTK2+Xft build, for instance: 
http://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/mozilla.org/mozilla/releases/mozilla1.7.11/contrib/mo
zilla-i686-pc-linux-gnu-1.7.11-gtk2+xft.tar.gz .

> The mozilla-firefox package from debian unstable, last I checked, supported
> embedding, as does the one from Ubuntu:
i'm afraid debian's migration to gcc-4.0 makes the provided firefox and eclipse incompatible:
the swt-gtk....so uses libstdc++.so.5 and debian's firefox libstdc++.so.6 which will most likely 
crash.

> Eclipse should work with any Mozilla (not Firefox) from mozilla.org. 
you're right. after diving deeper into mozilla.org i found the downloads for gtk2+xft. my bad.

i'm not sure what to do with this issue: may original problem is solved, but the problem of rather 
meagre informations regarding the browser to use (mozilla vs firefox, firefox of mozilla.org vs 
firefox of debian/suse/rh, ...) and the uninformative error-message persists.
you may close it if you think it's ok to do so.

Unfortunately NS_InitEmbedding can return an error code of -2147221164 for 
various initialization problems, so it's difficult to give a succinct error 
message here.

I've updated the SWT FAQ entry http://eclipse.org/swt/faq.php#browserlinux to 
mention Firefox and its requirement for having linkable Gecko libraries.
